verse: This is what the Lord God says.
This is what the Lord God says.

Then he took me through the entrance into the holy rooms for the priests that were located on the north side of the temple, beside the north gatehouse. Looking toward the west, I saw that there was a special place at the back of the temple area.

He said to me, “This is the place where the priests are to boil the restitution offering and the sin offering, and where they will bake the grain offerings in order not to bring them out to the outer courtyard and transmit holiness to the people.”
Then he brought me out to the outer courtyard and led me past the four corners of the courtyard. I saw there was a court at each corner of the courtyard— a court in each corner of the courtyard.
In the four corners of the courtyard were enclosed courts, forty cubits long and thirty cubits wide—the same measurement for each of the four of them.
A stone structure went all around the inside of all four of the rooms, and hearths for boiling were constructed beneath the structure all the way around.
Then he said to me, “These are the kitchens where those who minister in the temple are to boil the sacrifices of the people.”
